sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

In the shown quadrilateral QRST in the figure, it is given that \(QR = QT \). The bisectors of \(\angle RQS \) and \(\angle SQT \) meet the sides \(RS \) and \(ST \) at the points U and V respectively. Then prove that UV is parallel to RT .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
$$\text{In the triangle $RQS$ , $QU$ is the bisector of $\angle RQS $. So, we can write}$$
\[
	\frac{\input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{} }{US } = \frac{QR }{QS }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
$$\text{In the triangle $SQT$ , $QV$ is the bisector of $\angle SQT $. So, we can again write}$$
\[
	\frac{TV }{\input[s2v1]{s2v2} } = \frac{QT }{QS }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{TV }{VS } = \frac{\input[s2v3]{}\input[s2v4]{} }{QS }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, from the above two results, we can write
\[
	\frac{RU }{\input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{} } = \frac{TV }{VS }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now in the triangle RST, UV is a straight line such that 
\[
	\frac{RU }{US } = \frac{TV }{VS }
\]
That means UV divides two sides of triangle RST in the same ratio. Which means that \input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} is parallel to RT . "}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["R", "U"], "text": "$$\text{Since in the triangle $RQS$, $QU$ is the angle bisector of $\angle RQS$, we can use the angle bisector theorem to write: $\frac{RU }{US } = \frac{QR }{QS }$}$$"}, {"data": ["V", "S", "Q", "R"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle SQT, since QV is the angle bisector of $\angle SQT$, we can use the angle bisector theorem to write:}$$
\[
\frac{TV }{VS } = \frac{QT }{QS }
\],$$\text{also, since, $QR = QT$, therefore, $\frac{TV }{VS } = \frac{QR }{QS }$}$$"}, {"data": ["U", "S"], "text": " "}, {"data": ["U", "V"], "text": "$$\text{From the converse of Thale's theorem, we can prove that $UV$ is parallel to $RT$.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
